title: 109_hr5079
content: The Act titled "Oregon Water Resources Management Act of 2006" and an extension of the Bureau of Reclamation's participation in the Deschutes River Conservancy are discussed. Section 301 of the Oregon Resource Conservation Act of 1996 is amended to change the Deschutes River Basin Working Group to the Deschutes River Conservancy Working Group. The amendment includes representatives from private interests and the environmental community, with a funding allocation of $2,000,000 during fiscal years 2006 through 2015. The Deschutes River Basin Working Group is amended to the Deschutes River Conservancy Working Group, with a funding allocation of $2,000,000 for each fiscal year from 2006 to 2015. SEC. 3. WALLOWA LAKE DAM REHABILITATION ACT. Definitions for the Wallowa Lake Dam Rehabilitation Program include Associated Ditch Companies, Incorporated, the Secretary of the Interior, and the program itself. The Secretary may provide grants or agreements with tribal, State, and local entities for the Wallowa Lake Dam Rehabilitation Program. Conditions include meeting Oregon's dam safety standards and the Associated Ditch Companies assuming liability for work done with Federal funds. The United States is not liable for damages related to facilities rehabilitated or constructed with Federal funds. The Federal share of costs for activities authorized under this section cannot exceed 50 percent. No expenditure by the Bonneville Power will be credited against the Federal share of costs. The Secretary must comply with Oregon State water law when carrying out activities funded under this section. The Federal Government is prohibited from holding title to any facility rehabilitated or constructed, as well as from being responsible for the operation and maintenance of such facilities. Activities funded under this section are not considered a supplemental benefit under Federal reclamation law. $6,000,000 is authorized for the Secretary to pay the Federal share of costs. The Secretary's authority under this section will end 10 years after enactment. SEC. 4. Little Butte/Bear Creek Subbasins, Oregon, water resource study. The Secretary of the Interior may participate in the Water for Irrigation, Streams and the Economy Project study. $500,000 is authorized for the Bureau of Reclamation, with a 50% non-Federal share requirement. The non-Federal share for the Water for Irrigation, Streams and the Economy Project study can be in the form of in-kind services determined by the Secretary of the Interior. The authority for this provision will end 10 years after enactment. SEC. 5. NORTH UNIT IRRIGATION DISTRICT. This section may be cited as the ``North Unit Irrigation District Act of 2006''. The Act of August 10, 1954 is amended to include additional terms. The Contract for the North Unit Irrigation District is modified to increase irrigation service to approximately 59,000 acres and update the classification of irrigable lands within the project. The Contract for the North Unit Irrigation District is modified to increase irrigation service to approximately 59,000 acres and update the classification of irrigable lands within the project. The classified irrigable land comprises 58,902.8 acres authorized to receive irrigation water. Amendments include ensuring irrigation service is provided to the designated acreage and allowing for instream purposes. The North Unit Irrigation District Contract is modified to increase irrigation service to 59,000 acres and update land classification. The amendment allows for instream purposes, as required by Oregon State law, for conserved water projects. Annual installment payments for construction charges will be fixed and equal starting in 2006. The North Unit Irrigation District Contract is modified to include instream purposes for fish or wildlife as required by Oregon State law. This amendment also includes natural flow rights out of the Crooked River held by the District. The North Unit Irrigation District Contract is modified to include instream purposes for fish or wildlife as required by Oregon State law. This amendment also includes deleting certain provisions related to securing final decrees from the State court. The North Unit Irrigation District Contract may be renegotiated in the future by the Secretary of the Interior, upon written request from the District directors and consent of the Commissioner of Reclamation.
